description: A power supply on the sending device has failed. The
sysHwPowerSupply object identifies the failed supply.
The number and status of power supplies powering the Shelf/Chassis.
variables.name: CTRON-SSR-HARDWARE-MIB::sysHwPowerSupply

description: A power supply on the sending device has recovered
after failure. The sysHwPowerSupply object identifies
the recovered supply.
The number and status of power supplies powering the Shelf/Chassis.
variables.name: CTRON-SSR-HARDWARE-MIB::sysHwPowerSupply

description: A Fan tray on the sending device has failed. The
sysHwFan object identifies the failed fan tray.

event.Summary: Fan tray failed and its current state is $v1

description: The current state of the fans located inside the Shelf/Chassis.
variables.name: CTRON-SSR-HARDWARE-MIB::sysHwFan

description: A Fan tray on the sending device has recovered
after failure. The sysHwFan object identifies
the recovered Fan tray.

event.Summary: Fan tray recovered and its current state is $v1

description: The current state of the fans located inside the Shelf/Chassis.
variables.name: CTRON-SSR-HARDWARE-MIB::sysHwFan

description: A temperature inside the chassis on the sending device has exceeded
normal operating temperature. The sysHwTemperature object
identifies the current status.

event.Summary: Temperature exceeded and its current status is $v1

description: The current temperature status of the Shelf/Chassis.
variables.name: CTRON-SSR-HARDWARE-MIB::sysHwTemperature

description: A temperature inside the chassis on the sending device has returned
to normal operating temperature. The sysHwTemperature
object identifies the current status.

event.Summary: Temperature is normal and its current status is $v1

description: The current temperature status of the Shelf/Chassis.
variables.name: CTRON-SSR-HARDWARE-MIB::sysHwTemperature

description: A module has been inserted into the chassis.
sysHwModuleSlotNumber identifies the slot the module was inserted into.
The physical slot number of the module in the Shelf/Chassis.
variables.name: CTRON-SSR-HARDWARE-MIB::sysHwModuleSlotNumber

description: A module has been turned off or removed from the chassis.
sysHwModuleSlotNumber identifies the slot the module was removed from.

event.Summary: A module has been turned off or removed from the chassis

description: The physical slot number of the module in the Shelf/Chassis.
variables.name: CTRON-SSR-HARDWARE-MIB::sysHwModuleSlotNumber

description: A backup control module that was in standby mode has taken over
for a failed primary control module. Poll sysHwControlModuleBackupState
for current state of backup control module. sysHwModuleSlotNumber is the index
into the sysHwModuleTable for the now active control module.

event.Summary: Back up control node standby mode activated

description: The physical slot number of the module in the Shelf/Chassis.
variables.name: CTRON-SSR-HARDWARE-MIB::sysHwModuleSlotNumber

description: A backup control module that was in standby mode has changed to
inactive or notInstalled. Poll sysHwControlModuleBackupState
for current state of backup control module.

event.Summary: Back up module standby mode is inactive

description: The physical slot number of the module in the Shelf/Chassis.
variables.name: CTRON-SSR-HARDWARE-MIB::sysHwModuleSlotNumber

description: A line card module which was in the online state changed to the
offline state indicating an error condition.

event.Summary: A line card module state changed from online to offline

description: The physical slot number of the module in the Shelf/Chassis.
variables.name: CTRON-SSR-HARDWARE-MIB::sysHwModuleSlotNumber

description: The CPU utilization has exceeded the value of capCPUMaxThreshold
after having been below the value of capCPUMinThreshold. Once
this trap has occurred it will not occurred again until the
utilization has dropped below capCPUMinThreshold. Poll
capCPUMinThreshold and capCPUMaxThreshold to determine the
configured threshold settings.

event.Summary: CPU utilization $v2% has exceeded the value of capCPUMaxThreshold

description: The physical slot number of the module in the Shelf/Chassis.
variables.name: CTRON-SSR-HARDWARE-MIB::sysHwModuleSlotNumber

description: The CPU utilization expressed as an integer percentage.
This is calculated over the last 5 seconds at a 0.1 second
interval as a simple average.
variables.name: CTRON-SSR-CAPACITY-MIB::capCPUCurrentUtilization

description: The polAclDenied trap indicates that a message was
dropped because of a 'deny' ACL. The polAclName and polAclItem
identify the entry in the polAclTable. The ifIndex value identifies
the interface on which the deny ACL was applied.

event.Summary: $v1 dropped a message on the action of deny ACL

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CTRON-SSR-TRAP-MIB::polAclDenied CTRON-SSR-POLICY-MIB::polAclName s EXAMPLE CTRON-SSR-POLICY-MIB::polAclItem i 0 IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999

description: The administratively assigned name to this static route entry.
variables.name: CTRON-SSR-POLICY-MIB::polAclName

description: This row's unique identifier within a given ACL set. Member of the ACL set
are numbered from 1 to 256. If Item is set to 0, and rowStatus is destroy,
all rows for this set are destroyed.
variables.name: CTRON-SSR-POLICY-MIB::polAclItem

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex
